subject: Re: [junit] execute shell command in Junit to start server?
msgSnippet: ... How do you know whether a process started? What would the assertion look like? As for reading the log file, that should be straightforward: just open it,
messageBody:
Waani Toss wrote:

> I wanted to know if the shell program called
> "start.sh" which starts the server started or not. My
> junit test has to check if it stars and also check the
> log file.

How do you know whether a process started? What would the assertion look
like?

As for reading the log file, that should be straightforward: just open
it, read its contents into a string, then make some assertions on its
contents.

> public static void main(String[] args)
> {
> StartServer s= new StartServer();
> s.testProgramStarted();
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run (StartServer());
>
> // System.out.println("h");
> }

No, no, no....

Just this:

public static void main() {
junit.textui.TestRunner.main(
new String[] {"junit.samples.StartServer"};
}

Even better, forget main(), and just run this from the command line:

java -cp junit.jar;<your classes directory> junit.textui.TestRunner
junit.samples.StartServer

Good luck.
